Sentence: Bingo is a classic card game for four of more players.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Bingo uses two standard 52 playing card decks.
Label: Fact

Sentence: More decks can be used depending on the number of players and the number of playable spaces.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Before gameplay can begin, a caller must be selected.
Label: Act

Sentence: To do so, players must choose a random card from a shuffled deck.
Label: Duty

Sentence: The player with the lowest card becomes the caller.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Ties are broken with repeated drawings.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The caller shuffles both decks and then passes out five cards, faced up, to each player.
Label: Act

Sentence: The other deck is just for the caller.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The caller then draws cards from the shuffled deck and announces the rank and suit.
Label: Act

Sentence: If a player has that card in their hand, they place it faced down on the table.
Label: Duty

Sentence: When a player has all of their cards faced down, they shout “Bingo!” and win the round.
Label: Act

Sentence: Casino is a classic card game for 2 to 4 people and is played with a standard 52 card deck.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The objective of Casino is to be the first player to win 21 points.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Before gameplay can begin, a dealer must be selected.
Label: Act

Sentence: To do so, players must choose a random card from a shuffled deck.
Label: Duty

Sentence: The player with the lowest card becomes the dealer.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Ties are broken with repeated drawings.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The dealer then deals two cards to their opponents, two cards to the middle, and two cards to themselves.
Label: Act

Sentence: They do this twice so that everybody has four cards.
Label: Act

Sentence: The four middle cards are faced up.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The remaining deck forms the stock.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Players win cards by matching cards in the middle with cards from their hands.
Label: Act

Sentence: The simplest way to match cards is to pair up a card in the middle with a card in your hand.
Label: Act

Sentence: Players can also match cards by building them.
Label: Act

Sentence: To build a card, a player can combine a card from their hand with a card in the middle only if the resulting combination matches another card in their hand.
Label: Act

Sentence: For example, if a player has a 5 and a 2 in their hand and there is a 3 in the middle, a player can play their 2 on the 3 and say that they are building 5.
Label: Act

Sentence: The other players then have an opportunity to either take the built 5 or to continue adding cards to the middle.
Label: Act

Sentence: If the other players can't do so, then on the original player's next turn, they may pair up their 5 with the 2 and the 3.
Label: Act

Sentence: Players can also match cards by calling them.
Label: Act

Sentence: To call a card, a player can leave a pair in the middle, if they have another card of the same kind in their hand.
Label: Act

Sentence: For example, if a player has two 5s in their hand and there is a 5 in the middle, a player can place one of their 5s onto the middle 5 and say they are calling 5.
Label: Act

Sentence: The other players then have an opportunity to take the called 5 if they have a 5 in their hand.
Label: Act

Sentence: If they don't, then on the original player's next turn, they may use their other 5 to take the two middle 5s.
Label: Act

Sentence: In Casino, Aces are worth 1.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Faces cards are not worth anything and must be matched by simple pairing.
Label: Fact

Sentence: If a player can not match any cards, they must place one of their cards in the middle.
Label: Duty

Sentence: If a player runs out of cards in their hand, they must wait until all players have run out of cards in their hands before the dealer can deal out four more cards to everyone.
Label: Duty

Sentence: Concentration, or Memory, is a classic card game for 2 or more players.
Label: Fact

Sentence: It is played with either a standard 52 playing card deck or a specialty deck.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The objective is to be the player with the most matched pairs.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Before gameplay can begin, the order of play must first be established.
Label: Act

Sentence: Every player draws from a shuffled deck of cards.
Label: Duty

Sentence: With 2s low and Aces high, players arrange themselves in a circle with highest to lowest going clockwise.
Label: Duty

Sentence: Ties are broken by a redraw of the two players.
Label: Fact

Sentence: After shuffling the deck again, any player can arrange the cards on a flat surface in a faced down grid pattern.
Label: Act

Sentence: Beginning with the player who drew the highest card and going clockwise, players take turns flipping over two cards.
Label: Duty

Sentence: If the cards form a pair, then the player takes them from the grid for themselves.
Label: Act

Sentence: If the cards do not form a pair, then the player flips them back over on the same spot as before.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Both cards should only remain flipped up for 5 seconds before being flipped back down again.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Every player should be able to see the cards' position.
Label: Fact

Sentence: After all of the cards have been paired up, the player with the most pairs wins.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Go Fish, or Authors, is a card game that requires 2-5 players and a standard 52 playing card deck.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The objective of Go Fish is to have the most “books”, or 4 of a kind, by the end of the game.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Before the game officially begins, the job of dealer must be assigned to one of the players.
Label: Duty

Sentence: To decide who is dealer, every player receives 1 card from a shuffled deck of cards. With Aces being high and 2’s being low, the player with the lowest card is the dealer.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The players assemble in a circle and the dealer shuffles the cards.
Label: Act

Sentence: The player to the dealer’s immediate right cuts the shuffled deck and the dealer then passes the cards out face down, clockwise, and one at a time.
Label: Act

Sentence: If less than 4 people are playing, each player receives 7 cards
Label: Fact

Sentence: If more that 4 people are playing, each player receives 5 cards.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The remaining deck is placed face down in the middle of the circle to form the “ocean”.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The game begins when the player to the left of the dealer “fishes” by asking another player if they have a certain card in their hand (e.g. “Do you have any Queens?”).
Label: Act

Sentence: If the player does have the type of card asked for, they must give the asker all of that type they possess.
Label: Duty

Sentence: If a player does not have the typed asked for, they say “go fish” and the asker picks up the top card from the ocean
Label: Act

Sentence: The gameplay then moves to the left and the next person fishes for cards.
Label: Fact

Sentence: A player makes a book when they have 4 of a kind.
Label: Act

Sentence: When a book is made, the player places the 4 cards face up in a pile in front of them to verify to the other players that they made a book.
Label: Act

Sentence: The game ends when all 13 books are made
Label: Fact

Sentence: The player with the most books wins.
Label: Fact

Sentence: If a player runs out of cards during the game, they may select one from the ocean when it is their turn.
Label: Act

Sentence: If there are no more cards in the ocean, they are out of the game and the number of books they have is final.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Conquian is a two-player rummy type game and is played with standard playing cards.
Label: Fact

Sentence: In Conquian, the 10s, 9s, and 8s are removed form a 40-card deck.
Label: Act

Sentence: Before the game can begin, an initial dealer must be selected.
Label: Act

Sentence: To do so, players will pick a random card from a shuffled deck.
Label: Act

Sentence: The player with the lowest card is the dealer.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The dealer then shuffles the deck and passes out 10 card one by one to each player.
Label: Act

Sentence: The remaining cards form the stock  are placed face down in the middle of the gameplay area.
Label: Act

Sentence: Players are able to lose their cards by melding.
Label: Fact

Sentence: A meld is either 3 or 4 cards of the same rank or 3 or more cards of the same suit in sequence.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Gameplay begins with the player opposite of the dealer.
Label: Fact

Sentence: At the start of their turn, players will select a card either from the stock pile or the discard pile.
Label: Act

Sentence: The card can only be kept if it can be used in a meld.
Label: Fact

Sentence: If it can’t, it is placed face up in the discard pile next to the stock pile.
Label: Duty

Sentence: If a player can use the card selected, they may also play any other melds in their hand.
Label: Act

Sentence: A player’s turn ends with them discarding a card.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The first player to meld eleven cards wins the game.
Label: Fact

Sentence: If the stock pile runs out, the game ends in a tie
Label: Act

Sentence: California Jack is a trick-taking game played with four people.
Label: Fact

Sentence: It uses a standard 52 playing card deck with Aces high and 2s low.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The objective of California Jack is to get the most tricks.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Before gameplay can begin, a dealer must be selected.
Label: Act

Sentence: To do so, players must choose a random card from a shuffled deck.
Label: Duty

Sentence: The player with the lowest card becomes the dealer.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Ties are broken with repeated drawings.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The dealer shuffles the deck and then passes out six cards to each player.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The remaining deck is placed face up to form the stock.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The first card showing establishes trump for the round.
Label: Fact

Sentence: The dealer leads the first card and, going clockwise, players try to follow suit or trump if they can.
Label: Act

Sentence: The highest card takes the trick.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Starting with the winner of the trick and going clockwise, players take one card from the stock.
Label: Act

Sentence: The winner then leads the next trick.
Label: Act

Sentence: The round ends when all cards have been played.
Label: Fact

Sentence: Players receive 1 point for each Ace of trump, 2 of trump and Jack of trump won in a trick.
Label: Fact

Sentence: 1 point is also awarded to the player who has the highest total number of points in cards
Label: Fact

Sentence: 10 = 10 points, ace = 4, king = 3, queen = 2, jack = 1
Label: Fact

Sentence: The first player to reach 10 points wins the game.
Label: Fact

Sentence: If a player fails to draw a card after their turn, they must skip their next turn.
Label: Duty

Sentence: Players are required to reshuffle the deck when the draw pile is empty.
Label: Duty

Sentence: At the beginning of their turn, each player is instructed to draw a card from the deck.
Label: Duty

Sentence: In the case of owned property, the player has to pay the owner a specific amount.

Label: Act
